title: The Effect of Virtual Reality Application on Balance and Gait Speed in Individuals With Alzheimer's Dementia
description_brief: The aim of study is to investigate the effect of virtual reality application on balance and gait speed in individuals with Alzheimer's Dementia.
description_detailed: The aim of study is to investigate the effect of virtual reality application on balance and gait speed in individuals with Alzheimer's Dementia. The study consisted of 32 subjects, which were diagnosed as mild or moderate AD by the neurologist. The balance, fall risks and gait speed were assessed. Training group was trained with games selected from different categories such as balance and aerobic exercises with Nintendo Wii virtual reality device for 6 weeks, 1 session 30 min, 2 times a week.
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention described is a virtual reality (VR) application aimed at improving balance and gait speed in people with Alzheimer's disease. This is a non‑pharmacologic, rehabilitative/physical therapy intervention (VR games / Nintendo Wii exercises) rather than a drug or biologic that targets Alzheimer pathology or is intended primarily as a cognitive enhancer or an agent to treat neuropsychiatric symptoms. Evidence and trial details (pilot study) indicate VR training sessions (e.g., Nintendo Wii, 6 weeks, 30 min sessions) were used. citeturn0search4turn0search8turn0search5
